Description:
Wood is currently recruiting for Offshore Instrumentation Designer with extensive experience in oil and gas industry.Responsible for supporting the objectives of the Health, Safety, Security, Environmental and Quality policy and Information Security Management policy by adhering to applicable procedures and work practices while fulfilling of duties.
Execute assigned work in accordance with the applicable project procedures, DDI and standards, including Wood Group, India Operations and/ or project procedures on safety and quality control within the man-hour budget and the project schedule targets.
Prepare air distribution schedules and indicate positions of air manifolds on plot plans.
Prepare instrument cable block diagrams.
Prepare cable drum schedule.
Follow the design guidelines for the preparation of cable racking / routing drawings.
Prepare a cable schedule from the cable block diagram and project specifications / standards.
Prepare sketches for control room and equipment room layouts based on inputs.
Develop the instrument design index based on EFD’s and Instrument Index.
Using the instrument database and project specifications / standards, follow guidelines in the preparation of instrument hook-up drawings & installation drawings.
Produce instrument location drawings based on the instrument database, EFD’s and plant layout drawings.
Develop / provide input on the 3D Model to clarify instrument requirements on the model inclusive of cable racking, junction boxes, air headers and field instrument placements.
Prepare instrument loop diagrams and termination schedules utilising the SPI database.
Prepare panel layout detail drawings based on inputs.
Incorporate instrument supplier data received into instrument design database, termination schedules and loop diagrams.
Provide input for piping / instrumentation interface drawings.
Provide input for electrical / instrumentation interface drawings.
Maintain the instrument design database and drawing register in a current project state.
Assist in preparation of enquiry requisitions for instrument cable and junction boxes.
Assist in the preparation of the Instrument design MTO.
Liaise with engineers to ensure design intent is implemented.
Assist in resolving site queries relative to the instrument design, obtain redline mark-ups and backdraft documents to As-built status.
Assist in the preparation of Instrument ‘End of Job’ documentation.
Perform any other duties assigned within reason by the Principal Designer / Dy. Manager / Chief Engineer / Chief Specialist.
Highlight as applicable to Dy. Manager / Chief Engineer / Chief specialist / Lead Engineer regarding change flags.g)Required  Software experience : Mandatory : E3D /AutoCAD, SPI . Preferred : SP3D , AVEVA Instrumentation
